intro: Adenophora remotiflora f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically narrower than those of the species, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for gardens and botanical collections.
